description: This is a beautiful mahogany plywood, stitch & glue kayak from the illustrious Pygmy Boat Company. A 17' Queen Charlotte: the first of all Pygmy's models. -It is used but in very good condition. Pygmy kayaks are only offered as kits and yet the boats when completed are among the best you can buy. -This one is newly recoated with the same West System Epoxy as is used to build it, and also partially finished with Z-Spar Flagship UV resistant marine varnish, always the final step after new epoxy. -A skeg has been added to this most maneuverable of Pygmy models to increase straight-line tracking for touring purposes. It would be very easy to remove or modify it, for maximum playfulness in surf. -This is a kayak with a very spacious entrance and interior. There are no storage hatches (Pygmy sells kits to add them if desired) or bulkheads (one thing this means is, if you are flexible enough, you can actually lay flat and sleep in the boat...). Very beautifully & intelligently styled, completely solid and leak free, and very tough and durable. This is a hard-chined boat with very flat deck for immunity to high winds. Most amazing however, is this 17 footer weighs in at about 37 pounds: the only other place to find this type lightness is with a kevlar boat costing several thousand dollars or more. ALSO INCLUDED: 1. Two full size flotation bags for emergency buoyancy if desired, to compensate for the lack of bulkheads. 2. The remainder of the new quart of Z-spar Flagship varnish bought specifically for this boat. After the new coat of epoxy some of it was applied to the deck for UV protection. I believe enough remains to easily give the entire hull a second coat, desirable in the long run. Overall condition excellent with some evidence of use and normal signs of kit boat construction. No paddle included. Sorry: no "test rides". Much additional info available about this and all Pygmy models online, including much nicer images than are provided here. Price firm. Thanks for viewing.
title: Excellent 17' Pygmy "Queen Charlotte" Ocean Kayak

description: Hi - We are looking to sell our 83 Sundancer 260. Boat is in great condition for its age and has lots of recent work to it. All of the exterior upholstery has been replaced in 2014 as well as a complete engine rebuild in 2012. Since then, we have only put 12 hours on the engine. It has a Merc 260 hp engine and runs really strong. The engine is currently winterized. Interior is in fantastic shape, and spacious. It sleeps 6 people. There is two bedrooms along with a kitchen area, shower/bathroom. It has hookups for a hot water tank, refrigerator, sinks, stove and plenty more. Trailer is included. Items that will need attention. Trailer lights work intermittently and the trailer brakes will need to be serviced. Also, the battery for the boat is getting weak, I would suggest replacing for the new season. I have all the paperwork ready for transfer. If you have any questions, please let me know. Asking $8,500 or best offer will consider trades! description: Im selling my Hobie Revolution, the hull has a crack in it near where the mirage drive is locked into place.  I repaired it with a marine epoxy a few years ago and  I tested it briefly (less than 10 minutes) and it didn't leak but I'm not making any promises hence the low price.  The mirage drive on the side that had the leak doesn't lock into place because of the epoxy on the crack.  The other still locks and its functional.  The kayak comes with everything it originally came with.  The rudder seems to need some adjustments as well, it will turn left and right and pull up but will not go down.  I think the inside cables need tightened.  I also mounted and wired a fish finder that runs on a 12v battery that will also be included.  Price is firm as i believe even with all the issues the mirage drive by itself is worth $500.  Please text or email for a faster response.  Any questions just ask.  Thanks.
title: Hobie Revolution

description: 1962 Lonestar Malibu 14' boat for sale, the boat was redone this spring, it was stripped and painted, cream color on the bottom and a burgundy on the top. 4 seats on swivels that match the paint color. the motor is a 1959 Johnson 35 super seahorse, the lower end of the motor was rebuilt with new seals and has fresh oil. the motor runs perfectly and is hands free to operate, on the dash in front of the drivers seat is the steering wheel, a key start, electric choke, switch for lights and a switch for the bilge pump that is in the rear of the boat. the boat was seam sealed before painting. it sits on a refinished trailer that has new bearings, tires and rolers. this boat is in almost perfect shape an goes through the water well. it can be used as a cruiser or also a fishing boat because of the swiveling seats. i am asking 2200$ OBO, call or text with any questions or for more pictures
title: 1962 Lonestar Malibu 14'

description: Remodeled 95% inside,,, 2 engines,, 1 engines runs,,,, nice boat to have... will take $1000 cash down,, and you get title... then you can pay me other $1000 in march when you launch the boat on river to  see how she Runs,,, .MUST SELL....I really Have no time to enjoy it....will be showing it all weekend,, will have it on the river running near Oakmont,,, first come with cash gets it Why I'm selling It ? I only bought the Boat on July 2nd this year,, Just so i could enjoy the 4th of July Firework in Pittsburgh on the river,, however,, once we launched the Boat to began our journey,, the engine kept stalling,,, so we anchored it near Marina and went exploring why the engine kept stalling,, we changed spark plugs,, rotary and distributor cap, plug wires etc,, yet,, the engine kept stalling,,, after a few days we located the problem,, see last 3 pics below,,,, the fuel and water filter had rust in it and was polluting the carburetor,, so,, i removed it and ran a straight line to engine,, and the problem was solved,, so I have a new filter I have yet to install back on boat,,, to be honest,, I havnt been back up to the boat in 2 months,, i have no time,, so the boat just sat tied to shore for 7 weeks,, the marina owner took it upon himself to pull it out of the water for me and placed it in drydock,,, where it now sits,,,, I just do not have time for it..... https://youtu.be/h6aSXkU41eM Copy and just paste these links for a video inside boat https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h6aSXkU41eM&feature=youtu.be NO LEAKS !!!! show contact info See Inside boat Video here >>> https://youtu.be/h6aSXkU41eM boat is at Logan's marina. 7 Coxcomb Hill Rd New Kensington, Pennsylvania

description: I spent last winter/spring/summer restoring this great boat. I received a number of compliments and questions about it every time I took it out. Upgrades include: - Reinforced/re-fiberglassed Stringers - New Floor - New Carpeting - New Wiring, new 2 battery (1,2,both) system - New Bluetooth Gauge style stereo - New Seats - Freshly painted interior The boat is powered by a 115HP Mercury "Tower of Power" inline 6 cylinder outboard. I know it's the end of the season, and I need my garage back for the winter. $1,500 is as low as I can go. title: Classic Runabout - Thunderbird Falcon
